benchmark_details.name: Multi-Grain Stereotype (MGS) Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The Multi-Grain Stereotype (MGS) dataset consists of 51,867 instances across gender, race, profession, religion, and other stereotypes, designed to benchmark stereotype detection in Large Language Models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for evaluating and understanding stereotypes in LLMs, enabling effective bias detection and monitoring.

data.source: Curated from multiple existing datasets including StereoSet and CrowS-Pairs.
data.annotation: Crowdsourced labeling into categories such as stereotype, neutral, and unrelated.

methods: Use of explainable AI (XAI) techniques including SHAP, LIME, and BERTViz
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model evaluation on training and testing datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores indicate better classifier performance in detecting stereotypes.
methodology.baseline_results: BERT, ALBERT-V2, and other PLM models fine-tuned on the MGS dataset show improved performance over traditional methods.
methodology.validation: Models were validated using explainability techniques to ensure alignment with human interpretations of stereotypes.

targeted_risks.harm: The dataset aims to detect and address harmful stereotypes in AI, promoting fairness.
